lead_paragraph: The former N.F.L. linebacker Steve Foley was charged with a felony after his pit bulls bit a woman and killed her puppy in Richmond, Tex. He surrendered at the Fort Bend County Jail on Wednesday and was released on $10,000 bond, a sheriff’s spokeswoman said. Two pit bulls belonging to Foley attacked a neighbor, causing serious injury when they bit her, according to court documents. Foley, 32, played with Cincinnati, Houston and San Diego. His career ended after he was shot by an off-duty police officer in San Diego in 2006. He pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor charge of drunken driving and was sentenced to five years’ probation.
